positive.review:
It's pretty much what I dreamed about.

WW2 Setting Card game with cool and unit dependent mechanics.

I've played mostly single player so I can't comment much how balanced PVP is but it's somewhat annoying that the devs push you so hard to spent some money on the game.

I also dislike the implementation of some units, which doesn't make much sense.
It's a game, but you still expect some consistency when it comes to the portrayal of various war equipment.

But so far I had fun playing.
You just need to play ranked games 24/7 to fill up the weekly crate and collect the rarer cards.
It's a pretty rad game but I really wish there wasn't so many people spamming countermeasures

I'm sure there's a matching algorithm which means you win 4 /loose 3 in a loop. So eventually you slowly progress. At times frustrating, but they keep adding new content to scramble your brains - and make it interesting again. Best played whilst watching mind-numbing TV as you have to wait for people to end turn, which would be tedious if it was the only thing you are doing. Big praise indeed to the art style and sound effects.
daamn this shit is kinda good :D It lets you create different builds, decks or whatever you may call it. Cheers :D

A surprisingly engaging and historically-themed card game. The mechanics are well-balanced, requiring both strategic deck building and tactical in-game decisions. Matches are quick and tense, offering a satisfying and accessible experience for both casual and hardcore card game enthusiasts.

This is a really fun deck builder especially for WWII history enthusiasts. The art and units are cool. It's easy to learn and they give you plenty to start building decks with, however it's deep enough to continue to find interesting combos. I haven't felt overwhelmed at all in matches so the match making seems decent or there may just be lots of casual players. Despite this I have had some really tough opponents in ranked matches, even starting at the very bottom. I'd def recommend this to anyone who loves deck builders and WWII especially since it's free to play.

Good card game.
Its free to play, collectable cards.
It has some strategy to it.

Like any collectible card game, digital or otherwise, this is a game where money matters. However, they've ameliorated that with draft mode and single player v. AI mode. Overall the strategy is good, the art is excellent, it plays well, there's regular card rotation to keep the game from getting stale, and it's enjoyable.

At low level as a casual this is very fun and works great on Steam Deck (despite saying it doesn't).  Steadily unlocking cards for free to expand your deck builds is great and there are some reasonable ways to spend to increase progress if you enjoy the game enough to warrant it.

Late game balance I have no idea.

A Beginner-Friendly and Generous Card Game

Gameplay & Accessibility:This game is one of the most beginner-friendly card games Iâ€™ve played. The mechanics are simple and easy to pick up, without overwhelming complexity. Even as someone with experience in other card games (like Magic, Hearthstone, and PokÃ©mon), I found this game refreshingly straightforward while still offering plenty of depth in deck-building.

Progression & Rewards:The game is very generous with packs and cards, especially for new players. I donâ€™t agree with the negative comments about it being â€œpay-to-winâ€ â€” from my experience, you can progress and build competitive decks without needing to spend money.

Matchmaking & Playerbase Despite the gameâ€™s relatively modest budget and smaller playerbase, the matchmaking is excellent. Matches are found within seconds, which is impressive. A lot of Chinese players seem to be active, which helps keep the community lively.

Overall Impression: This is honestly one of the best free-to-play card games Iâ€™ve tried. It combines simplicity with strategic depth, fair progression, and quick matchmaking. I highly recommend it to anyone interested in card games, whether youâ€™re a beginner or a veteran. Well done to the developers!

[h3] amazing WW2 card collector and battle game.
Panzer Elite approved! [/h3]

The most expensive free game on the market!

This game is great! The card building and gameplay is one of a kind. Fun and generally quick battles take place between you and an opponent, with the nations and cards of your choice. The possibilities feel endless, and there's just enough luck of the draw involved to make it interesting.

But player beware: Their in game currency they treat like real gold and diamonds. You could spend $100 and not end up with much. They recently had a watch for a board item. It was the equivalent of $80 in "diamonds". They've gotta make money somehow, sure, but they price themselves out of a better experience for sure.

I definitely recommend playing. I love it, but when you reach higher levels you run into people with money and it shows!

Edit: Suffers more and more from balance issues, forcing you to play gimmicky decks to be competitive. Could be such a fun game, but it can't get out of it's own way. 

7/10 but oh what could have been!

I love playing as Germany and rushing down my enemies. Nothing beats the feeling of a perfect opening hand! Sure, some cards can feel overpowered when used against you, but that just makes winning even sweeter. Just a friendly warning: be prepared to lose a lot when you start!

A fairly simple yet surprisingly in-depth deck builder. As a veteran with a deep appreciation for the history of World War I and World War II, I found this experience genuinely enjoyable. Whether you're looking to play competitively or just kick back in a more casual setting, the choice is entirely yours. The community has been incredibly helpful and responsive, which adds to the overall positive experience.

The only notable downside is that some members have reported issues with cheating. Hopefully, those concerns will be addressed and resolved in future updates.

Pretty standard CCG. 

Has a very interesting "Front-line" mechanic. Similar to a battlefield, you have a support row where you add cards into, then you try to fight for control on the front-line, which allows you to attack the opponent's location and units. If you are in a defensive position, you have to attack the units on the front-line before you can move those units up to the front-line. There are some units, specifically artillery and aircraft that can reach the opponents support row from your support row.. Everything is very WW2 themed so if you like that, it's cool.
Rather well-balanced, with stunning art.

negative.review:
The idea is great, the visuals and sound design too. Cards are thematically accurate and varied. However, balance is horrible, and has been for a solid while now. Every major update, there are a few either new or old strategies that are extremely simple to play once you copy a deck, have no proper counter if any at all, and are extremely frustrating to play against. There are often strategies, where the opponent can just totally deny any and all of your plays, and you can do nothing to prevent it. If you don't play meta or broken decks, good luck... 

There is no report function (in a PvP game mind you) - either for suspected cheats/abuse or stalling or whatever... Cosmetics are overpriced, which is not a problem for me, since I don't care about them much, but worth to mention.  

If you want to just play the game, tinker with strategies and decks, and not play something well known, cheap, or broken, you will be frustrated and not have fun 9/10 games you play.

I guess the devs donÂ´t know what balance is ... the fact that the soviet union is able to take control of your units AND can destroy them to get a random friendly unit that cost 1-2 more is unbalanced as hell ... even the control card says that the card normally will be returned to the owner but NOPE .. you can literally destroy them to avoid that AND get a stronger unit. 
ThatÂ´s not the only thing that is unbalanced .. many thing for example like the 0 cost units, cheap orders that can attack HQ (i mean the german card Bismarck costs at least 10 credits and is a elite card which is balanced but the others from other nations ? most of time limited or standard cards) or cheap orders which causes 6 damage or similar to units ..

japan too for example .. they are not op enough right ? "each players shuffles their hand into their deck, then draws 4 cards" so you can literally destroy players with 8-9 cards on their hand and i bet the cards you draw will be trash (at least for me all the times) .. and thatÂ´s btw a limited card so players can have it 3 times on their deck ...

Nations like U.S or Germany donÂ´t have guards btw so you need to combine them with UK or other nations with guards and germany donÂ´t have heals for HQ (except for "Alpenfestung" but that card is just trash as hell and no one really uses this) so germany lacks both guards and heals .. If you play draft then youÂ´re RIP early if youÂ´re getting rushed by 0 cost units or getting destroyed by control cards or by cheap orders or everything combined ... and on top of that you can also be unlucky with the rng if you want heal orders with germany by combing the nation with UK for example.

Draft was the only thing that was at least a bit fun and i played the last months only that because you need to decide from random cards for your deck but with all the unbalanced cards now ? forget it .. 150 gold wasted 
Combinations like japan + France .. in which world is this historic ?
U.S players (or other players who wants to play most of time their fav nation) for example are just Rip against those combinations with those unbalanced cards and orders .. ofc you loose fun if you realize that you have no chance with your fav nation. 
The best thing is also if youÂ´re in a match for example in a draft match then the game randomly freezes sometimes and you need to close the game and if you return (restarting the game only taking a few sec) you only see that you have lost the match automatically .... nice to see something like this ..... especially in a draft match .. and the Problem is 100% not my PC.

Thnx for ruining this game 1939. Been playing it for 6 years, it was amazing in the beginning. Relatively fair and balanced gameplay where you actually could think and predict. Now the game is just bloated by overpowered cards. Every new expansion they have to add new 'interesting' cards which just completely throws the balance of the rails. And this is where my main point lays. 1939 absolutely has NO clue how to balance this game and if they do balance the game its MONTHS too late. They really had a chance to make this game in something good after the mobile release but they fucked it up hard with the balancing, guttiing the tournaments which was a HUGE pro on this game and not listening to the fanbase at all. I know im not the only one on this because the reviews have been terrible lately as it should be sadly from the current state of the game. 3/10 would not recommmend. Oh and btw if you are a new player.. gl getting a good deck, you either have to sink in a lot of money or play a lot with mediocre decks, yes its possible, no its not fun and scummy business practices.

The idea is great, the visuals and sound design too. Cards are thematically accurate and varied. However, balance is horrible, and has been for a solid while now. Every major update, there are a few either new or old strategies that are extremely simple to play once you copy a deck, have no proper counter if any at all, and are extremely frustrating to play against. There are often strategies, where the opponent can just totally deny any and all of your plays, and you can do nothing to prevent it. If you don't play meta or broken decks, good luck... 

There is no report function (in a PvP game mind you) - either for suspected cheats/abuse or stalling or whatever... Cosmetics are overpriced, which is not a problem for me, since I don't care about them much, but worth to mention.  

If you want to just play the game, tinker with strategies and decks, and not play something well known, cheap, or broken, you will be frustrated and not have fun 9/10 games you play.
Fun in the beginning, but after a few weeks it became just impossible to win any game any more. Just constantly loosing to perfect decks and perfect draws. Thumbs down.
If you want to know what the worst game balance in CCG is like, play this trash.

wow talk about ruining a game jesus christ. havent play in awhile decent to come back and my god the over-powered cards they released are horrible and absoulety ruined the game i will now delete this game and never touch it again. i advise you not to play it. its a waste of time!

Honestly when i first started playing this game it was a lot of fun. I grew up playing Magic the Gathering and to play a similar style of game with WW2 units, i was sucked in quickly! At the beginning, i enjoyed the single player games and duel event... built a few simple decks and managed to do okay. Then to progress playing single player or dual it said i needed coins that i didnt have.  I forked out some money for a 3 month package to get coin, cards, and some other perks. I then built some awesome decks and was doing great. Since then they have come out with several "updates"... all these "updates" consist of is a new series of cards that are overpowered and basically retire your older cards. I have stopped paying and as a result have been slipping further down the rank.

So bottom line , if you don't pay more money to buy the newest series of cards ( every 2 months or so) , you will fall behind and more often than not lose to the newer superior cards. There are ways to play and get coins to get the newer cards but its a drop in the bucket. For those of us that work, have families, and don't have hours to spend each night in the game LOSING TO THE NEWER DECKS to get the coins... your time is better spent on a game that you you can actually advance in without pulling out the wallet.

Also as mentioned in other reviews the soviets are OP and the hammer and sickle remain despite them losing the rising sun and german insignias.... because russia is no longer communist under Putins leadership lol? 

Its a shame, this game has great potential... the artwork is great and the game play is fun when you have a decent deck or you are playing against an equal opponent. Too bad the devs didnt expand on that and keep it more balanced, instead they catered to those with deep pockets.

I don't often review games simply to tell people to AVOID them, but avoid this one. Main reason is the community, second reason is the pay to win, third reason is the lack of balance, final reason and the nail in the coffin for me is the insane lean into the nazi deck being the overwhelming meta. I have better card games to spend my time on.

I very rarely make a review for any games.  I use to play Kards back when it was Beta.  I loved this game.  I'm a history buff so a card game with a WWII theme was a solid SOLD for me.  Now though?  I can't play this anymore.  No other game in my library makes me so angry that I want to throw my mouse or phone at the wall.  As it stands now, you're only going to win on ladder with a hyper aggro deck and it's pretty much caveman thinking of, "Duh...I hit face."  No strategy.  No thinking.  Just "I hit face."  There are so many different cards in this game with a variety of combos and decks that you can play with, but it's now just a few meta decks to win on ladder.  This isn't the worse part for me though.

The worst part is the toxicity of the players.  There's no chat, but you are allowed to pick and choose the emotes you want to use and nothing gets me more angry than playing against an aggro player who spams, "It's A Good Day To Die," over and over again as they are smashing your face in.  You take more than 3 seconds to decide your move and you get spammed with, "Is It My Turn Yet?", again and again.  Sure, there's a way to turn this off, but you have to do it with every match you play because the devs don't want to give you the option to do so because it will switch off a small part of how they make their money.  Yes.....emotes can be purchasable in this game.  So after over 5 years of playing this game, I'm done with it.  Find another card game because I'm pretty sure there are far better ones that have a less toxic player base and more variety of decks you can play.

So you boot up the game for the first time.
It's a card game, so you won't be given resources for your first deck - fair enough, devs don't want people to just make new account for each decks.
So you have to invest time to make deck - fair. Oh wait, what's that? Cards that you grinded for are in a rotation where you can't use them after certain amount of time? Oh, so you want me to keep grinding for new cards, all the while my previous grind becomes worthless after set amount of time, resulting in a drain of my time/money in cyclical fashion?
Nah, I'm good, I see it becoming a sunk cost fallacy game after some time. I'm fine with just watching videos of some cool decks then.
P.S. My 100 hours are from years ago when there was no card rotation, nor wildcards.

I had posted on their Steam update page where these changes were implemented. It was more or less what this review is about and people were agreeing with me there as well, but the post was deleted at some point, so I have decided to mark this action up here where they can't tamper with the reviews. You can judge for yourself what this indicates about the developers. Had they not deleted my post I wouldn't be so antagonistic towards them, but now I'm going to twist that knife as hard as I can. Your shameful act is for all to see now.

Started out strong and was enjoyable, but the cracks have started to show. A game about history that does not care for history. The Germans being censored is kind of "understandable", but some time after this, the censorship didn't stop there. Now they have changed the Japanese rising sun flag to it's modern equivalent. All signs point to more censorship in the future.

Don't you fools understand that it's this distinction that separated war-time Japan from modern Japan? If your justification for this was that people would take offense to seeing the military flag, how do you think this will appear to them now? Now people are going to think that the old Japan which committed countless atrocities is the same as the one now. In this way, are you suggesting they are still on the warpath, the same militaristic government as before? Now people are going to get triggered seeing the normal flag, too. You have only dug yourselves deeper into a hole.

And don't even get me started about the other implications this brings. Ok, lots of Asian people suffered under Japan so they would get mad at their imagery. Lots of people suffered under German rule, and the Germans themselves don't like to talk about their past. So what about the Soviet imagery? You haven't changed those and people suffered plenty because of them. By this half-way censorship you open yourselves up to all kinds of attacks; Is one people's suffering greater than others? Should everyone else's suffering then be ignored? The Japanese and German imagery was too horrible to look at, but apparently communism was sooooo much better in comparison. You censor one, but not the other, even though all of the complaints are valid. So by this logic, you should ban the Soviet imagery too in the name of the values you preach, but in so doing you defeat the purpose of a WW2 themed game, the hook being historical accuracy. Why did you even bother making it if you were going to censor it? You follow this logic long enough, there will be no end to the censorship once you start.

The case to ban Soviet imagery is made stronger still, because Putin has been using Soviet rhetoric to justify his war in Ukraine. The Russians are constantly making pleas to Ukraine to remember how good it was to be under their rule during communism. You say you stand with Ukraine, but why haven't you done anything about the Soviet imagery then? Wouldn't that make you hypocrites? If you switched Japans military flag for their normal flag, you could just as well switch the Soviet imagery for Russian flags. Oooohhh but that would be offensive, current Russia is not the USSR, we would lose players! Now think how the Japanese players must feel.

You see what happens? You pick and choose only the things you want to defend, but in so doing you make a lot of mistakes and open yourselves up to a slew of other problems. You make yourselves look disingenious and as hypocrites, and then to correct this problem you try and fix it with MORE censorship until everyone leaves to greener pastures. It looks like favoritism and propaganda even though you didn't mean it as such. Maybe you did, hell if I know, but I wouldn't be surprised. Either you ban everything or you leave it untouched, but as I mentioned before that if you're going to censor things, why did you choose this theme?

But the gravest mistake of all is not the censorship, but rather how this game uses it to censor history itself. Much like others before you, you have opened up a dangerous rhetoric which is that history can be changed to suit your reality. You are revising history. You are changing the truth. A card game which uses its historical theme as a selling point, but does not respect it. A game which sees it fit to change it's values on a whim. Knowing this, how can any player trust this game enough to spend money on it?

Where will the censorship end? I have outlined a number of upcoming scenarios where more censorship is required.
The answer therefore is that it will never end, unless the developers decide to stand behind a policy of integrity. In fact, if people are going take offense to history, maybe it's the wrong game for them, so why would you pander to them, ever think about that? Maybe it lowers the quality for everyone else who actually care for the game? Instead try and branch out to people who enjoy the subject? Just something to consider.

All in all, I can no longer support this developer. Play it if you must, but do not spend money on it if you have any respect for yourself. The game is SO GOOD otherwise, where you can actually climb ranked with jank decks and play board instead of solitaire, but this is simply too much. Show us that you have some backbone, show to us that you can be trusted. Until then, in this age of ideological warfare, I refuse to support the enemy.

Unfortunate. It has turned pay to win. 

How so?
Battle passes are basically mandatory for progression. You cannot hope to complete your collections in a reasonable amount of time without paying in some way. This is how the free-to-play model works.

Rare cards dominate the battlefield. You need cards that often aren't available for newer players, expect thousands of hours of grind if you would be interested in 

Power creeping. There is a huge incentive to have the greatest and latest cards in order to outperform the meta. 

Meta decks are forced upon you in some way. Even if you want to play it casual, you can't (most times). Meta decks are seen in casual lobbies around 70-80% of the time. You are forced to play the meta if you want to win.

Diminished strategy gameplay. There used to be strategy early on with the front mechanic. Now, have fun playing against players that destroy your units right as you play them, or worse punish you from playing anything. 

You are here to sit though your units getting a beating, and you cannot do anything unless you have the exact counter card. Hope you are lucky that way.

I love a good card game. Played Legend of the 5 Rings back in day. This game though? My god, never seen so many beyond broken card/combo's in my life. I'm all for a few tasty dbl card smack downs, but seriously the amount of cards that literarilly wipe the board before you can even get to turn 5 is crazy. A good card game needs some luck, for sure. However, for the most part the cards you get turn 1 and the 1st cpl draws are going to determine your match. There is scarcely a battle that last past 8-10 turns, so if you are into fast attack decks rinse, wash, repeat then you will like this game. Customer service is good, only had to wait a cpl days for a name change even though I swear I never picked my initial name. I do not consider this pay to win, since I can be competitive without forking money over. However I think pretty much anyone can win at this game, as long as your personal best main trait is luck of the draw. If you are looking for a slower paced card game, where you must really rely on your deck versus a variety of situations, Then RUN!

Thnx for ruining this game 1939. Been playing it for 6 years, it was amazing in the beginning. Relatively fair and balanced gameplay where you actually could think and predict. Now the game is just bloated by overpowered cards. Every new expansion they have to add new 'interesting' cards which just completely throws the balance of the rails. And this is where my main point lays. 1939 absolutely has NO clue how to balance this game and if they do balance the game its MONTHS too late. They really had a chance to make this game in something good after the mobile release but they fucked it up hard with the balancing, guttiing the tournaments which was a HUGE pro on this game and not listening to the fanbase at all. I know im not the only one on this because the reviews have been terrible lately as it should be sadly from the current state of the game. 3/10 would not recommmend. Oh and btw if you are a new player.. gl getting a good deck, you either have to sink in a lot of money or play a lot with mediocre decks, yes its possible, no its not fun and scummy business practices.

The idea is great, the visuals and sound design too. Cards are thematically accurate and varied. However, balance is horrible, and has been for a solid while now. Every major update, there are a few either new or old strategies that are extremely simple to play once you copy a deck, have no proper counter if any at all, and are extremely frustrating to play against. There are often strategies, where the opponent can just totally deny any and all of your plays, and you can do nothing to prevent it. If you don't play meta or broken decks, good luck... 

There is no report function (in a PvP game mind you) - either for suspected cheats/abuse or stalling or whatever... Cosmetics are overpriced, which is not a problem for me, since I don't care about them much, but worth to mention.  

If you want to just play the game, tinker with strategies and decks, and not play something well known, cheap, or broken, you will be frustrated and not have fun 9/10 games you play.
Fun in the beginning, but after a few weeks it became just impossible to win any game any more. Just constantly loosing to perfect decks and perfect draws. Thumbs down.
If you want to know what the worst game balance in CCG is like, play this trash.

wow talk about ruining a game jesus christ. havent play in awhile decent to come back and my god the over-powered cards they released are horrible and absoulety ruined the game i will now delete this game and never touch it again. i advise you not to play it. its a waste of time!

Honestly when i first started playing this game it was a lot of fun. I grew up playing Magic the Gathering and to play a similar style of game with WW2 units, i was sucked in quickly! At the beginning, i enjoyed the single player games and duel event... built a few simple decks and managed to do okay. Then to progress playing single player or dual it said i needed coins that i didnt have.  I forked out some money for a 3 month package to get coin, cards, and some other perks. I then built some awesome decks and was doing great. Since then they have come out with several "updates"... all these "updates" consist of is a new series of cards that are overpowered and basically retire your older cards. I have stopped paying and as a result have been slipping further down the rank.

So bottom line , if you don't pay more money to buy the newest series of cards ( every 2 months or so) , you will fall behind and more often than not lose to the newer superior cards. There are ways to play and get coins to get the newer cards but its a drop in the bucket. For those of us that work, have families, and don't have hours to spend each night in the game LOSING TO THE NEWER DECKS to get the coins... your time is better spent on a game that you you can actually advance in without pulling out the wallet.

Also as mentioned in other reviews the soviets are OP and the hammer and sickle remain despite them losing the rising sun and german insignias.... because russia is no longer communist under Putins leadership lol? 

Its a shame, this game has great potential... the artwork is great and the game play is fun when you have a decent deck or you are playing against an equal opponent. Too bad the devs didnt expand on that and keep it more balanced, instead they catered to those with deep pockets.

I don't often review games simply to tell people to AVOID them, but avoid this one. Main reason is the community, second reason is the pay to win, third reason is the lack of balance, final reason and the nail in the coffin for me is the insane lean into the nazi deck being the overwhelming meta. I have better card games to spend my time on.

I very rarely make a review for any games.  I use to play Kards back when it was Beta.  I loved this game.  I'm a history buff so a card game with a WWII theme was a solid SOLD for me.  Now though?  I can't play this anymore.  No other game in my library makes me so angry that I want to throw my mouse or phone at the wall.  As it stands now, you're only going to win on ladder with a hyper aggro deck and it's pretty much caveman thinking of, "Duh...I hit face."  No strategy.  No thinking.  Just "I hit face."  There are so many different cards in this game with a variety of combos and decks that you can play with, but it's now just a few meta decks to win on ladder.  This isn't the worse part for me though.

The worst part is the toxicity of the players.  There's no chat, but you are allowed to pick and choose the emotes you want to use and nothing gets me more angry than playing against an aggro player who spams, "It's A Good Day To Die," over and over again as they are smashing your face in.  You take more than 3 seconds to decide your move and you get spammed with, "Is It My Turn Yet?", again and again.  Sure, there's a way to turn this off, but you have to do it with every match you play because the devs don't want to give you the option to do so because it will switch off a small part of how they make their money.  Yes.....emotes can be purchasable in this game.  So after over 5 years of playing this game, I'm done with it.  Find another card game because I'm pretty sure there are far better ones that have a less toxic player base and more variety of decks you can play.

So you boot up the game for the first time.
It's a card game, so you won't be given resources for your first deck - fair enough, devs don't want people to just make new account for each decks.
So you have to invest time to make deck - fair. Oh wait, what's that? Cards that you grinded for are in a rotation where you can't use them after certain amount of time? Oh, so you want me to keep grinding for new cards, all the while my previous grind becomes worthless after set amount of time, resulting in a drain of my time/money in cyclical fashion?
Nah, I'm good, I see it becoming a sunk cost fallacy game after some time. I'm fine with just watching videos of some cool decks then.
P.S. My 100 hours are from years ago when there was no card rotation, nor wildcards.

I had posted on their Steam update page where these changes were implemented. It was more or less what this review is about and people were agreeing with me there as well, but the post was deleted at some point, so I have decided to mark this action up here where they can't tamper with the reviews. You can judge for yourself what this indicates about the developers. Had they not deleted my post I wouldn't be so antagonistic towards them, but now I'm going to twist that knife as hard as I can. Your shameful act is for all to see now.

Started out strong and was enjoyable, but the cracks have started to show. A game about history that does not care for history. The Germans being censored is kind of "understandable", but some time after this, the censorship didn't stop there. Now they have changed the Japanese rising sun flag to it's modern equivalent. All signs point to more censorship in the future.

Don't you fools understand that it's this distinction that separated war-time Japan from modern Japan? If your justification for this was that people would take offense to seeing the military flag, how do you think this will appear to them now? Now people are going to think that the old Japan which committed countless atrocities is the same as the one now. In this way, are you suggesting they are still on the warpath, the same militaristic government as before? Now people are going to get triggered seeing the normal flag, too. You have only dug yourselves deeper into a hole.

And don't even get me started about the other implications this brings. Ok, lots of Asian people suffered under Japan so they would get mad at their imagery. Lots of people suffered under German rule, and the Germans themselves don't like to talk about their past. So what about the Soviet imagery? You haven't changed those and people suffered plenty because of them. By this half-way censorship you open yourselves up to all kinds of attacks; Is one people's suffering greater than others? Should everyone else's suffering then be ignored? The Japanese and German imagery was too horrible to look at, but apparently communism was sooooo much better in comparison. You censor one, but not the other, even though all of the complaints are valid. So by this logic, you should ban the Soviet imagery too in the name of the values you preach, but in so doing you defeat the purpose of a WW2 themed game, the hook being historical accuracy. Why did you even bother making it if you were going to censor it? You follow this logic long enough, there will be no end to the censorship once you start.

The case to ban Soviet imagery is made stronger still, because Putin has been using Soviet rhetoric to justify his war in Ukraine. The Russians are constantly making pleas to Ukraine to remember how good it was to be under their rule during communism. You say you stand with Ukraine, but why haven't you done anything about the Soviet imagery then? Wouldn't that make you hypocrites? If you switched Japans military flag for their normal flag, you could just as well switch the Soviet imagery for Russian flags. Oooohhh but that would be offensive, current Russia is not the USSR, we would lose players! Now think how the Japanese players must feel.

You see what happens? You pick and choose only the things you want to defend, but in so doing you make a lot of mistakes and open yourselves up to a slew of other problems. You make yourselves look disingenious and as hypocrites, and then to correct this problem you try and fix it with MORE censorship until everyone leaves to greener pastures. It looks like favoritism and propaganda even though you didn't mean it as such. Maybe you did, hell if I know, but I wouldn't be surprised. Either you ban everything or you leave it untouched, but as I mentioned before that if you're going to censor things, why did you choose this theme?

But the gravest mistake of all is not the censorship, but rather how this game uses it to censor history itself. Much like others before you, you have opened up a dangerous rhetoric which is that history can be changed to suit your reality. You are revising history. You are changing the truth. A card game which uses its historical theme as a selling point, but does not respect it. A game which sees it fit to change it's values on a whim. Knowing this, how can any player trust this game enough to spend money on it?

Where will the censorship end? I have outlined a number of upcoming scenarios where more censorship is required.
The answer therefore is that it will never end, unless the developers decide to stand behind a policy of integrity. In fact, if people are going take offense to history, maybe it's the wrong game for them, so why would you pander to them, ever think about that? Maybe it lowers the quality for everyone else who actually care for the game? Instead try and branch out to people who enjoy the subject? Just something to consider.

All in all, I can no longer support this developer. Play it if you must, but do not spend money on it if you have any respect for yourself. The game is SO GOOD otherwise, where you can actually climb ranked with jank decks and play board instead of solitaire, but this is simply too much. Show us that you have some backbone, show to us that you can be trusted. Until then, in this age of ideological warfare, I refuse to support the enemy.

Unfortunate. It has turned pay to win. 

How so?
Battle passes are basically mandatory for progression. You cannot hope to complete your collections in a reasonable amount of time without paying in some way. This is how the free-to-play model works.

Rare cards dominate the battlefield. You need cards that often aren't available for newer players, expect thousands of hours of grind if you would be interested in 

Power creeping. There is a huge incentive to have the greatest and latest cards in order to outperform the meta. 

Meta decks are forced upon you in some way. Even if you want to play it casual, you can't (most times). Meta decks are seen in casual lobbies around 70-80% of the time. You are forced to play the meta if you want to win.

Diminished strategy gameplay. There used to be strategy early on with the front mechanic. Now, have fun playing against players that destroy your units right as you play them, or worse punish you from playing anything. 

You are here to sit though your units getting a beating, and you cannot do anything unless you have the exact counter card. Hope you are lucky that way.

I love a good card game. Played Legend of the 5 Rings back in day. This game though? My god, never seen so many beyond broken card/combo's in my life. I'm all for a few tasty dbl card smack downs, but seriously the amount of cards that literarilly wipe the board before you can even get to turn 5 is crazy. A good card game needs some luck, for sure. However, for the most part the cards you get turn 1 and the 1st cpl draws are going to determine your match. There is scarcely a battle that last past 8-10 turns, so if you are into fast attack decks rinse, wash, repeat then you will like this game. Customer service is good, only had to wait a cpl days for a name change even though I swear I never picked my initial name. I do not consider this pay to win, since I can be competitive without forking money over. However I think pretty much anyone can win at this game, as long as your personal best main trait is luck of the draw. If you are looking for a slower paced card game, where you must really rely on your deck versus a variety of situations, Then RUN!
